meanings.definition: A sudden charge out of a besieged place against the enemy; a sortie.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight led a sallies from the castle to surprise the invaders.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers planned multiple sallies to break through the enemy lines.
meanings.sent3: During the battle, the sallies from the fortress kept the enemy on their toes.
meanings.sent4: Her sallies into the enemy camp were swift and unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The sallies of the defenders were crucial in repelling the attack.

meanings.definition: A witty or lively remark, especially one made as a form of challenge or to provoke laughter.
meanings.sent1: His sallies always brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's sallies were the highlight of the show.
meanings.sent3: Her sallies at the dinner table kept the conversation light and enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: The sallies of the jester never failed to amuse the royal court.
meanings.sent5: His quick-witted sallies were the talk of the town.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden charge or attack.
meanings.sent1: The army sallies forth to meet the enemy head-on.
meanings.sent2: She sallies bravely into the unknown, ready for any challenge.
meanings.sent3: The cat sallies playfully after the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: He sallies out of his comfort zone to explore new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The hero sallies forth to rescue the captured princess.
